result.execSummary:
The defendant William Edward Parrish was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).
  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Provide DNA sample.  Undergo AODA assessment and any follow up counseling/treatment per agent.  Not to possess controlled substances w/o valid prescription and must notify agent w/in 24 hours if one is received.  Absolute sobriety at all times.  If a prescription is received the DE must maintain it in it's original bottle showing the DE's name, the name of the substance and the name of the doctor who prescribed it.  Random UA's per agent.  Any other treatment per agent.  Four (4) days credit if probation would be revoked.  ALL COURT ORDERED OBLIGATIONS TO BE PAID THROUGH CLERK OF COURTS WITHIN 60 DAYS OR SET UP PAYMENT ARRANGEMENTS.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for William Edward Parrish
Current: PO Box 229, Hillsboro, WI 54634 United States  (Effective: 11-04-2022)
Prior: N7196 Geier Rd, Wonewoc, WI 53968

2:05 pm.  Defendant William Edward Parrish in court.  Attorney Annie E Getsinger in court for William Edward Parrish.  Prosecuting attorney Gabriel David Arevalo in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Court states case and appearances.  Atty Getsinger states they are ready to proceed today and files plea paperwork.  State states the joint recommendations.  Atty Getsinger agrees, as does DE.  Court grants amendment to Cts 1 and 2.  DE pleads NC to counts 1 and 2.  Court questions DE on pleas/accepts/finds DE guilty.  Court advises DE re: voting rights and felony firearms warnings.  State makes statement re: the joint rec.  Atty Getsinger makes statement on behalf of the DE.  DE has nothing to add.  Court admonishes DE and sentences.

Ct 1:  NC - w/o repeaters and 2nd and subsequent enhancer
Ct 2:  NC - w/o repeaters and 2nd and subsequent enhancer
24 months probation on each concurrent to each other
Costs/surcharges of $518.00 x 2 to be paid to Clerk of Courts Office w/in 60 days or set up payment plan
DNA samples to be provided
Conditions of probation:
AODA and follow up treatment/counseling per agent
Absolute sobriety at all times
Not to possess any controlled substances w/o a valid prescription and if a prescription is received it must be reported to the agent w/in 24 hours
If a prescription is received the DE must maintain it in it's original bottle showing the DE's name, the name of the substance and the name of the doctor who prescribed it
Any other treatment per agent
Random UA's per agent
Four (4) days credit if probation would be revoked
Ct 3:  Dismissed/read-in
Ct 4:  Dismissed/read-in
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 29, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Telephone scheduling conference on August 3, 2022 at 04:15 pm.
Atty Getsinger received and waives reading of Information.  Atty Getsinger stands Mute, Court enters Not Guilty Plea, to be set for TSC.  Bond continues.

1:24 PM Prosecuting attorney Natalia J Gess in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant William Edward Parrish in court.  Attorney Annie E Getsinger in court for William Edward Parrish. Court finds probable cause, bind over for Br 3.
Waiver of Prelim on June 3, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Juneau Co. Jail
Preliminary hearing on June 2, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Cover Letter from Atty. Albrecht for reset
Juneau Co. Jail
Preliminary hearing on May 26, 2022 at 10:00 am.

02:07 PM Defendant William Edward Parrish in court with attorney Annie E Getsinger.  Defendant William Edward Parrish in custody.  Gabriel David Arevalo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Getsinger requests a preliminary hearing date.  Matter reset.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 26, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Juneau Co. jail

01:35 PM Attorney Annie E Getsinger in court.  Gabriel David Arevalo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court states case and appearances.  State notes DE is in Juneau Co jail and they need an OTP.  Court notes it's already been reset.
Return date on April 1, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Natalia J Gess appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant received and waives reading of complaint.  Court advises DE of charges/max penalties.  DE qualifies for public defender representation.  Time limits waived for preliminary hearing.  State does not object to a signature bond.  No objection from Atty Getsinger.  $1,000.00 SIGNATURE bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows: Absolute sobriety.  Not to possess any controlled substances w/o a valid prescription.  If a prescription is received the DE must maintain it in it's original bottle showing the DE's name, the name of the substance and the name of the doctor who prescribed it.  Take all medications as prescribed.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 11, 2022 at 09:00 am.  Return date scheduled for March 18, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

04:12 PM Atty. Hayes appears from LEC.  Gabriel David Arevalo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court reviewed complaint and sufficient probable cause to be held over.  Initial appearance scheduled for January 11, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
